title: DARE Update Custom Preferences
description: Use to customise DARE Update user prompt preferences.

hourlyCheck.title: Allow Hourly Update Attempts
hourlyCheck.description: Determines whether DARE Update should check for updates and attempt to silently install them once every hour. Uncheck this option to prevent DARE Update from checking for new updates once every hour (not recommended)

updatePrompts.title: Allow Recurring Update Prompts
updatePrompts.description: Determines whether DARE Update should prompt users to install pending cached updates on a recurring interval. Uncheck this option to disable all recurring update prompts (not recommended). To configure the behaviour of recurring update prompts, use the options under the "Scheduled Updates" section of this profile

autoUpdate.title: Automatic Self Updates
autoUpdate.description: Determines whether DARE Update automatically updates itself when new major and point releases are available. Uncheck this option if you prefer to manually update DARE Update

allowedAppInstalls.title: Allowed Installs
allowedAppInstalls.description: By default, all Apps within the DARE Update App catalog are available for installs. If you prefer to specify a list of Apps allowed for installs, specify the App identifiers below. You can specify as many unique identifiers as you wish, using the App Catalog unique identifiers for each App. App Catalog: www.dareupdate.co. Note: If you wish to allow installs for all Apps within the catalog with the exception of a select few Apps, skip configuring this setting and use the Excluded Installs setting. If you specify an App in this list which is also in the Excluded App Installs list, the exclusion will override this setting

excludedAppInstalls.title: Excluded Installs
excludedAppInstalls.description: By default, all Apps within the DARE Update App catalog are available for installs. If you wish to allow installs for all Apps in the catalog with the exception of some Apps, specify the Apps you wish to exclude below. You can specify as many unique App identifiers as you wish, using the App Catalog unique identifiers for each App. App Catalog: www.dareupdate.co. Note: If you wish to only allow installs for some specific Apps within our catalog, skip this setting and instead use the Allowed Installs setting to create your allowed installs list. If you specify an App exclusion which is also in the Allowed Installs list, only the exclusion will be respected

allowedAppUpdates.title: Allowed Updates
allowedAppUpdates.description: By default, all Apps within the DARE Update App catalog will be updated if installed. If you prefer to specify a list of Apps to allow updates for, specify the App identifiers below. You can specify as many unique identifiers as you wish, using the App Catalog unique identifiers for each App. App Catalog: www.dareupdate.co. Note: If you wish to allow updates for all Apps within the catalog with the exception of a select few Apps, skip configuring this setting and use the Excluded Updates setting. If you specify an App in this list which is also in the Excluded Updates list, the exclusion will override this setting

excludedAppUpdates.title: Excluded Updates
excludedAppUpdates.description: By default, all Apps within the DARE Update App catalog will be updated if installed. If you wish to allow updates for all Apps in the catalog with the exception of some Apps, specify the Apps you wish to exclude below. You can specify as many unique App identifiers as you wish, using the App Catalog unique identifiers for each App. App Catalog: www.dareupdate.co. Note: If you wish to only allow updates for some specific Apps within our catalog, skip this setting and instead use the Allowed Updates setting to create your allowed update list. If you specify an exclusion App below which is also in the Allowed App Updates list, only the exclusion will be respected

runType.title: Run Frequency Option
runType.description: This defines when to prompt users to install any pending updates. You can either limit user prompts to a specified weekly patch day, or alternatively select a frequency to prompt the users, e.g., once every 2 weeks

frequencyOption.title: Frequency to prompt users
frequencyOption.description: A recurring update frequency time window which determines how often users are prompted to install pending updates, e.g., Once every week

frequencyElapsedMode.title: Frequency Elapsed Behaviour
frequencyElapsedMode.description: Determines how frequently users should be prompted if they defer the update once the configured patch frequency time has elapsed. Deferring updates with Single Prompt Mode enabled causes update prompts to be postponed until the patch frequency has elapsed again. Recurring Prompt Mode ensures users are prompted to update on a regular recurring interval after deferring until they update, and the patch frequency will only be reactivated after the updates are installed

deferralWindow.title: Recurring Prompt Mode Deferral Window (Patch Frequency)
deferralWindow.description: When using recurring prompt mode, use this setting to define the amount of time in minutes a user can defer the update

patchDay.title: Patch Day
patchDay.description: The day of the week to prompt users to install cached updates

patchDayFrequency.title: Patch Day Prompt Frequency
patchDayFrequency.description: Determines how often users should be prompted to update on the configured patch day if they defer the update. Use the Single Prompt Mode to carry the deferral to the following weekly patch day, or alternatively, use Recurring Prompt Mode to continue to prompt users to update on a recurring interval on the configured patch day if they defer the update

patchDayDeferralWindow.title: Recurring Prompt Mode Deferral Window (Patch Day)
patchDayDeferralWindow.description: When using recurring prompt mode, use this setting to define the amount of time in minutes a user can defer the update before being prompted again

missedUpdatePrompt.description: When enabled, DARE Update will prompt the user to update whenever the device comes back online if it was offline on the defined patch day, or if the user deferred all update prompts when using Recurring Prompt Mode. Alternatively, leave this unchecked to wait until the next patch day to prompt the user if their device was offline on the previous patch day
missedUpdatePrompt.title: Missed Update Prompts

runLimitations.title: Run Limitation Options
runLimitations.description: Use this preference to limit which weekdays and times DARE Update is allowed to prompt users to install pending updates. Check the boxes next to any days you wish to allow DARE Update to prompt users, and uncheck any days you want update prompts to be skipped. If you allow DARE Update to run on a particular day, you can then limit runs to a specific time window using the start and end time fields. Note: If you have specified a weekly patch day and that day is not checked below, the patch day setting will override this setting

deferralOption.title: Select a Deferral Option
deferralOption.description: Use to define behaviour around update deferrals. To allow the user to continue deferring with no limit and force the update on-demand, select Disable Deferral Limit. To set a limit on the amount of allowed deferrals, select Specify Deferral Limit. Alternatively, you can disable deferrals completely by selecting Disable Deferrals, which will only allow a grace period for updates

specifyLimit.title: Deferral Limit
specifyLimit.description: Specify a custom deferral limit. The default deferral limit if not specified is 2

gracePeriodMinutes.title: Grace Period in Minutes
gracePeriodMinutes.description: The amount of time a user is given to save work before updates are installed automatically when there are no remaining deferrals. Default is 15 minutes

customIcon.title: Custom Icon
customIcon.description: A custom icon to be displayed on the user prompts. The default is the Self Service icon

initialPromptOverlayIcon.title: Initial Prompt Icon Overlay
initialPromptOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on the initial update prompts. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

customInitialPromptSize.title: Custom Initial Prompt Size
customInitialPromptSize.description: Use to customise the size of the initial prompt displayed to users when they can either defer or update. Note: Only configure this setting if defining custom prompt messages. If you are using the default prompt messages, customising prompt size is not recommended as the default prompt size is pre-configured to correctly match the size of the default message displayed

singleInitialQuitPromptMessage.title: Single App Initial Quit Prompt Message
singleInitialQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is 1 pending App update and the App can quit to update. This prompt offers the option to defer update

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires the App to quit...

multipleInitialQuitPromptMessage.title: Multiple Apps Initial Quit Prompt Message
multipleInitialQuitPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is multiple pending App updates and the Apps can quit to update. This prompt offers the option to defer update

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Important updates are pending which require Apps to quit...

singleSelfServiceQuitMessage.title: Single App Self Service Quit Prompt Message
singleSelfServiceQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the prompt shown when a user initiates Self Service updates and there is 1 pending App update that requires the App to quit

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires the App to quit...

multipleSelfServiceQuitMessage.title: Multiple App Self Service Quit Prompt Message
multipleSelfServiceQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the prompt shown when a user initiates Self Service updates and there are multiple pending App updates that require the Apps to quit

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Important updates are pending which require Apps to quit...

singleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.title: Single App Grace Period Quit Prompt Message
singleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there is 1 pending update and the App can quit to update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

multipleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.title: Multiple Apps Grace Period Quit Prompt Message
multipleAppGracePeriodQuitMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the grace period prompt shown when there are multiple pending updates and the Apps can quit to update. This prompt displays when there are no deferrals configured or remaining. The Apps which require an update will be listed below this message

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

singleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.title: Single App Initial Log Out Prompt Message
singleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there is 1 pending App update and the App requires a Log Out to update. This prompt offers the option to Defer or Log out

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires a Log Out...

multipleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.title: Multiple Apps Initial Log Out Prompt Message
multipleInitialLogOutPromptMessage.description: A custom message displayed on the initial prompt shown when there are multiple pending App updates and one or more Apps require a Log Out to update. This prompt offers the option to Defer or Log Out

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, A Log Out is required for one or more of the Apps listed...

singleSelfServiceLogOutMessage.title: Single App Self Service Log Out Prompt Message

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, An important update is pending which requires the App to Log Out...

inputAttributes.placeholder: E.g, Please save your work and click update...

multipleAppGracePeriodLogOutMessage.title: Multiple Apps Grace Period Log Out Prompt Message

customDeferButton.title: Custom Defer Button
customDeferButton.description: A custom Defer button label displayed on prompts where deferrals are allowed

customSkipButton.title: Custom Self Service Skip Button
customSkipButton.description: A custom Skip button label displayed on the Self Service update prompts that allows users to back out of installing updates without affecting deferrals

customUpdateButton.title: Custom Update Button
customUpdateButton.description: A custom Update button label displayed on prompts where Apps can quit to update

customLogOutButton.title: Custom Log Out Button
customLogOutButton.description: A custom Log Out button label displayed on prompts where Apps require a Log Out to update

appListType.title: App List Type
appListType.description: Determines how to display the list of Apps on the update prompts. Apps can either be displayed in a vertical scrollable list beneath the prompt message, or displayed horizontally as part of the prompt message. When using the horizontal list option, the list of Apps is stored in the appList variable

refreshInterval.title: Prompt Refresh Interval
refreshInterval.description: The amount of time in seconds the user prompts refresh. The prompts require a refresh to pull focus if the user swipes away to ignore the prompt and ensures they either select defer or update. The default value is 20 seconds. The minimum allowed value is 10 seconds

acceptableAppBundleIDs.title: Do Not Disturb Applications
acceptableAppBundleIDs.description: Application Bundle IDs specified here will prevent DARE Update from prompting users to update if the App(s) are identified as being active in the foreground (You can specify one or more Bundle IDs). To get Bundle IDs, enter the following in terminal (replacing Safari with the relevant App): defaults read /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/Info.plist CFBundleIdentifier

items.title: Do Not Disturb Application Bundle ID

acceptableCameraUsage.title: Do Not Disturb Camera Usage
acceptableCameraUsage.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if the camera is in use. Note: Apple Silicon Macs running macOS 12 (Monterey) do not accurately report camera usage, therefore this setting will be ignored. Upgrading to macOS 13 (Ventura) will resolve this issue for Apple Silicon Macs.

acceptableScreenSharing.title: Do Not Disturb Screen Sharing
acceptableScreenSharing.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if Screen Sharing is in use.

performLogoutUpdates.title: Perform Logout Updates
performLogoutUpdates.description: By default, DARE Update will perform all updates regardless of whether the update requires a Log Out. To have DARE Update only prompt users when no Log Out is required, set this option as false (not recommended)

updateProgressPosition.title: Quit Update Progress Position
updateProgressPosition.description: The position on the screen of the prompt which displays the progress of an App-quit update. The default position is top right.

updateProgressPrompt.title: Update Progress Prompt Behaviour
updateProgressPrompt.description: Determines the behaviour of the prompt shown when updates are in progress. You can either select a prompt that does not take focus over other running Apps (default), a prompt that does take focus over all other running Apps, or disable the progress prompt completely. If you chose to show no prompt, you can still configure an updates complete prompt to inform users the update has finished

updateProgressOverlayIcon.title: Update Progress Prompt Overlay Icon
updateProgressOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on the prompt shown during the App updates. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon, which on this prompt is the App icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

displayCompletePrompt.title: Display Complete Message
displayCompletePrompt.description: Determines whether a prompt is displayed to the user to inform them that the updates are complete. The prompt will inherit the same window position as the Update Progress prompt. Default is true

refreshInterval.description: The amount of time in seconds the user prompts refresh when deferrals have been configured for forced updates. The prompts require a refresh to pull focus if the user swipes away to ignore the prompt and ensures they either select defer or update. The default value is 20 seconds. The minimum allowed value is 10 seconds

acceptableAppBundleIDs.title: Do Not Disturb Applications
acceptableAppBundleIDs.description: Application Bundle IDs specified here will prevent DARE Update from prompting users to update if the App(s) are identified as being active in the foreground (You can specify one or more Bundle IDs). To get Bundle IDs, enter the following in terminal (replacing Safari with the relevant App): defaults read /Applications/Safari.app/Contents/Info.plist CFBundleIdentifier

items.title: Do Not Disturb Application Bundle ID

acceptableCameraUsage.title: Do Not Disturb Camera Usage
acceptableCameraUsage.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if the camera is in use. Note: Apple Silicon Macs running macOS 12 (Monterey) do not accurately report camera usage, therefore this setting will be ignored. Upgrading to macOS 13 (Ventura) will resolve this issue for Apple Silicon Macs.

acceptableScreenSharing.title: Do Not Disturb Screen Sharing
acceptableScreenSharing.description: Setting as True will prevent DARE Update from prompting users if Screen Sharing is in use.

performLogoutUpdates.title: Perform Logout Updates
performLogoutUpdates.description: By default, DARE Update will perform all updates regardless of whether the update requires a Log Out. To have DARE Update only prompt users when no Log Out is required, set this option as false (not recommended)

updateProgressPosition.title: Quit Update Progress Position
updateProgressPosition.description: The position on the screen of the prompt which displays the progress of an App-quit update. The default position is top right.

updateProgressPrompt.title: Update Progress Prompt Behaviour
updateProgressPrompt.description: Determines the behaviour of the prompt shown when updates are in progress. You can either select a prompt that does not take focus over other running Apps (default), a prompt that does take focus over all other running Apps, or disable the progress prompt completely. If you chose to show no prompt, you can still configure an updates complete prompt to inform users the update has finished

updateProgressOverlayIcon.title: Update Progress Prompt Overlay Icon
updateProgressOverlayIcon.description: An icon overlay on the prompt shown during App updates. The overlay is displayed on the bottom right of the main icon, which on this prompt is the App icon. Possible values are paths to a valid .png, .jpg or .icns file, or use the selfService variable for the Jamf Self Service icon

displayCompletePrompt.title: Display Complete Message
displayCompletePrompt.description: Determines whether a prompt is displayed to the user to inform them that the updates are complete. The prompt will inherit the same window position as the Update Progress prompt. Default is true
